adrFormatAddress: 150 E 94th St, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: My daughter has been at Hello, Mandarin! since she was 14 months old.  I have been so pleased with the entire program.  I appreciate the structure of the classes which keep my daughter engaged and learning as well as the eagerness of the instructor and staff to support my daughter’s learning and development during different stages of her growth.  Most importantly, my daughter loves attending.  So happy to have found such a great school!

text.text: My daughter has been at Hello, Mandarin! since she was 14 months old.  I have been so pleased with the entire program. originalText.text: Jiaoyue Lyu is a true professional and gifted teacher. My 6 yo daughter has studied music with her in a Mandarin language school for 2 years and continues private lessons now on piano and ukelele. She is a great communicator and was able to teach effectively over zoom for the past year. Classes are fun and challenging and she is friendly, energetic, and encouraging. Her new studio is clean and in a good location. She is well connected in the music world and organizes wonderful performance opportunities for the children. Highly recommend!

originalText.text:
My now 13 month old started with hello mandarin at 4 months old (we stumbled upon a free class and we’re excited to try something new!) he has picked up a love of the language, the songs, and the ukulele. Jiao is an extraordinary teacher who tailors the class to my son and his two friends.
Bonus? My husband and I have picked up some mandarin!
I could not recommend Hello, Mandarin more! In a city with so many different classes to offer, this continues to be our favorite!

text.text:

Bonus? My husband and I have picked up some mandarin!

originalText.text: Jiao Jiao Laoshi is an amazing musician and teacher who has been teaching my two children since they were 5 (now 7&8). She is incredibly organized and versatile where she could manage teaching students with different musical instruments, i.e mine learnt music theories, piano and ukulele (all in Mandarin Chinese), not to mention participating in fun performances through “hello mandarin”.  She’s also very enthusiastic and encouraging to her students with a great deal of patience.  I had recommended her to many friends and they all love her!!

originalText.text: We are so fortunate to know Jiaoyue who previously taught piano to my 11 year old son, and now teaches me (picking up piano as an adult). She is extremely talented, conveys musical concepts in an easy to grasp manner, and has a love for music that is contagious. Let me just say she brings joy to my Mondays! Do yourself a favor and commit, your future self will thank you :-)
